translation: zasiłek [help given, especially by the state or an organization, to people who need it, especially because they do not have enough money]
sentence: Your taxes pay for welfare benefits such as unemployment and sickness pay.

translation: intencja [formal; the fact that you want and plan to do something]
sentence: I spent half the morning on the phone, which wasn't really my intent.

translation: lepkość [the quality or state of being thick and sticky and not flowing easily]
sentence: The viscosity of the fluid in the system can be modified.

translation: źródło [a place where water naturally flows out from the ground]
sentence: Mount Sannine, which has a base of limestone, is the source of many mountain springs.

translation: jaskółka [a small bird with pointed wings and a tail with two points that flies quickly and catches insects to eat as it flies]
sentence: Certain of springtime, the swallows came!

translation: pogarszać [to make a bad situation worse]
sentence: Attempts to restrict parking in the city centre have further aggravated the problem of traffic congestion.

translation: ambona [a raised place in a church, with steps leading up to it, from which the priest or minister speaks to the people during a religious ceremony]
sentence: The pulpit appears to be of Byzantine origin.

translation: fusy [the small solid pieces that sink to the bottom of some liquids, such as wine or coffee, that are not usually drunk]
sentence: I wanted a last drink of coffee, but there were only dregs left.

translation: blady [very pale, in a way that looks unhealthy and not attractive]
sentence: Next to his tanned face, hers seemed pallid and unhealthy.

translation: chód, krok [formal; a particular way of walking; the particular way a horse walks or runs]
sentence: I recognized his gait from a distance. The pony's gait slowed from a canter to a trot.

translation: zasmucać [to make someone unhappy and angry]
sentence: Years later, this unfairness still aggrieves him.

translation: niedostateczny, skąpy [hardly any; not very much and not as much as there should be]
sentence: I paid scant attention to what she was saying.

translation: rozkosz, błogość [perfect happiness]
sentence: Lying on a sunny beach is my idea of sheer bliss.

translation: kleszcz [a small insect that sucks the blood of animals]
sentence: Several kinds of parasitic jungle ticks cause much annoyance to men and to beasts.

translation: prewencyjny, wyprzedzający [formal; done before someone else can act, especially to prevent them doing what they had planned]
sentence: The Treasury decided to raise interest rates as a pre-emptive measure against inflation.

translation: wyniosły [unfriendly and seeming to consider yourself better than other people]
sentence: She has a rather haughty manner.

translation: naruszenie, złamanie [an act of breaking a law, promise, agreement, or relationship]
sentence: He was sued for breach of contract.

translation: dok, nabrzeże [an area of water in a port that can be closed off and that is used for putting goods onto and taking them off ships or repairing ships]
sentence: The ship sailed into the dock to be refitted.

translation: proklamować, obwieszczać [formal; to announce something publicly or officially, especially something positive]
sentence: All the countries have proclaimed their loyalty to the alliance.

translation: ubóstwiać [formal; to make someone or something into a god; to consider someone or something to be so important that they are almost like a god]
sentence: The Romans used to deify their emperors.

translation: odkupienie, wybawienie [being saved from evil, especially according to the Christian religion]
sentence: Others find in the gospel of redemption the true theodicy.

translation: kadzidło [a substance that is burnt to produce a sweet smell, especially as part of a religious ceremony]
sentence: The commonest incense in ancient India was probably frankincense.

translation: poprzedzać, wyprzedzać [to be built or formed, or to happen, at an earlier date than something else in the past]
sentence: These cave paintings predate any others which are known.

translation: nakreślić, wytyczyć [formal; to describe or mark the edge of something]
sentence: The main characters are clearly delineated in the first chapter. The boundary of the car park is delineated by a low brick wall.

translation: karny, karzący [formal; intended as punishment]
sentence: There are calls for more punitive measures against people who drink and drive.

translation: piśmienny [able to read and write; having knowledge of a particular subject, or a particular type of knowledge]
sentence: The man was barely literate and took a long time to write his name.

translation: rozwijać, rozpościerać [(of a flag, sail, etc.) to become open from a rolled position, or to cause something to become open from a rolled position]
sentence: The demonstrators unfurled a large banner.

translation: kłuć, dźgać [to push or hit something forcefully and quickly, often with a thin or sharp object]
sentence: The doctor jabbed the needle into the dog's leg.

translation: sypialnia [old use; a bedroom]
sentence: This film about Henry VIII is set, almost entirely, in the king's bedchamber.

translation: zaczepiać, zagadywać [formal; to go up to or stop and speak to someone in a threatening way]
sentence: I'm usually accosted by beggars and drunks as I walk to the station.

translation: stary dziwak [informal; an old man, especially one who is strange or humorous in some way]
sentence: A couple of old codgers were sitting on the park bench, grumbling about the children.

translation: nieustający, nieustępliwy [continuing in a severe or extreme way]
sentence: The sun was relentless.

translation: sumienie [the part of you that judges how moral your own actions are and makes you feel guilty about bad things that you have done or things you feel responsible for]
sentence: My conscience would really bother me if I wore a fur coat.

translation: spójnik [a word that joins words, phrases or sentences, for example “and,” “but,” and “or”]
sentence: When you write a series of nouns or adjectives, such as 'purple, green and blue', you use a conjunction before the last one, instead of a comma.

translation: przynosić, dawać [to supply or produce something positive such as a profit, an amount of food or information]
sentence: The investigation yielded some unexpected results.

translation: radość [a feeling of happiness, usually because something good has happened to you, or something bad has happened to someone else]
sentence: He rubbed his hands in glee as he thought of all the money he would make.

translation: ganić, łajać [formal; to forcefully or angrily tell someone they should not have done a particular thing and criticize them for having done it]
sentence: In newspaper articles she consistently upbraided those in authority who overstepped their limits.

translation: czas wolny, rekreacja [the time when you are not working or doing other duties]
sentence: Most people only have a limited amount of leisure time.

translation: strzyc [to cut the wool off a sheep]
sentence: It was time for the sheep to be shorn.

translation: udusić [to kill someone by covering their face so that they cannot breathe]
sentence: He smothered the baby with a pillow.

translation: szczęśliwy traf [formal; the fact of something interesting or pleasant happening by chance]
sentence: Meeting her like that, and there of all places, was true serendipity!

translation: pozór, podobieństwo [a situation or condition that is similar to what is wanted or expected, but is not exactly as hoped for]
sentence: He was executed without even the semblance of a fair trial.

translation: świadomość, przytomność [the state of understanding and realizing something; the state of being awake, thinking, and knowing what is happening around you]
sentence: There's a growing consciousness about environmental issues among young people. He lost consciousness for several minutes.

translation: odmrożenie [injury to someone caused by severe cold, usually to their toes, fingers, ears, or nose, that causes permanent loss of tissue]
sentence: The climbers were all suffering from frostbite.

translation: spętać, skrępować [formal; to limit someone's freedom of movement or activity]
sentence: He felt himself trammeled by convention.

translation: szkopuł [informal; a problem or difficulty, especially one that is small, hidden, or unexpected]
sentence: There is just one small snag—where is the money coming from?

translation: krzaczasty [(of hair or fur) growing thickly]
sentence: A lot of his face was hidden behind a bushy moustache.

translation: susza [a long period when there is little or no rain]
sentence: The country's entire grain harvest has been hit by drought.

translation: okrutny, okropny, przerażający [very bad or unpleasant; violent and shocking]
sentence: Conditions in the prison were atrocious. She speaks French with an atrocious accent.

translation: nadąsany [refusing to smile or be pleasant to people, usually because you are angry about something]
sentence: She brought along a couple of sulky kids who didn't say a word the whole time.

translation: karb, nacięcie [a V-shaped cut in a hard surface]
sentence: The stick has two notches, one at each end.

translation: przyległy, sąsiedni [formal; very near, next to, or touching]
sentence: They work in adjacent buildings.

translation: nijaki, nieokreślony [very ordinary, or having no interesting or exciting features or qualities]
sentence: Their offices are in a nondescript building on the edge of town.

translation: mruczeć [(of a cat) to make a soft, low, continuous sound, or (of a machine) to make a similar sound]
sentence: The cat purred as I stroked its fur.

translation: żółć [the bitter, yellow liquid produced by the liver that helps to digest fat]
sentence: The critic's review of the play was just a paragraph of bile. Meat-eaters have to produce extensive bile acids in their intestines to properly digest the meat that they eat.

translation: inkantacja, zaklęcie [(the performance of) words that are believed to have a magical effect when spoken or sung]
sentence: Around the fire, tribal elders chanted incantations.

translation: gąszcz [an area of trees and bushes growing closely together]
sentence: He spent the morning trying to work his way through a thicket of statistics.

translation: niedbały, niesumienny [not being careful or giving enough attention to people or things that are your responsibility]
sentence: The judge said that the teacher had been negligent in allowing the children to swim in dangerous water.

translation: luźny, niedbały [not putting enough care, attention, or energy into something and so not doing it well enough]
sentence: Discipline in the classroom is very slack. He's been very slack in his work lately.

translation: naciągnąć, wykiwać [to deceive someone, usually by making that person do something that they did not intend to do]
sentence: The girls were duped by drug smugglers into carrying heroin for them.

translation: garbus [old-fashioned; someone with a large lump on their back, which makes them lean forward]
sentence: Her appearance in The Hunchback of Notre Dame made her the first actress to earn ten million dollars for a movie role.

translation: szary, ponury [disapproving; without interest or color; dull and boring]
sentence: She walked through the city centre with its drab, grey buildings and felt depressed.

translation: wcześnie rozwinięty, przedwczesny [(especially of children) showing mental development or achievement much earlier than usual]
sentence: A precocious child, she went to university at the age of 15.

translation: bezwładny, nieruchomy [not moving or not able to move; not energetic or interesting]
sentence: Vanessa lay inert on the sofa.

translation: porost [a grey, green, or yellow plant-like organism that grows on rocks, walls, and trees]
sentence: The water moved silently over moss and lichen covered slabs of rocks, forming small pools in the low spots.

translation: wściekły [extremely angry]
sentence: Dad will be livid when he finds out.

translation: uśmiechać się szeroko [to smile widely]
sentence: They grinned with delight when they heard our news.

translation: ryczeć [to make a long, loud, deep sound]
sentence: We could hear the lions roaring at the other end of the zoo.

translation: matowy [used to describe a surface or color or paint that is not shiny]
sentence: The paint is available in matte or gloss finish.

translation: kojarzyć się z, konotować [(of a word) to suggest a feeling, an idea, etc., as well as the main meaning]
sentence: To me, chocolate connotes pleasure and indulgence.
